name: Hilton Garden Inn Times Square

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel April 2nd and 3rd, 2010. We usually stay in more upscale hotels in New York and around the world but were meeting a family of 4 (2 teenagers) and chose this hotel and were EXTREMELY happy. The entire staff of this hotel should be commended for both the professional and friendly way they treat guests. The entire staff go out of their way to help guests. The hotel rooms are immaculate and while being on the small side have contemporary furnishings including a fridge, flat screen tv, micorwave and coffee maker. Very comfy beds. The location is perfect..only about a block or two off Times Square. The hotel does have an adjacent restaurant and bar but has lots of options right across 8th Avenue, including a Mexican, Chinese and Greek restaurant as well as a Starbucks and pizza place. Our next visit to New York will definitely include a stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. One other thing, we arrived at 11:35AM and our room was ready!!!
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel near Times Square

reviews.text: This is the place to stay in NYC - location, location, location!
reviews.title: Great Location :)

reviews.text: My husband and I, with 14 year old daughter stayed here for Spring Break (March 19 through 26, 2010). We definitely will return. The location simply can't be beat: right in the heart of the theatre district and Times Square just up the street. A great "Food Emporium" right next door to the hotel with incredible food offerings at a great price. The Food Emporium is a cross between Whole Foods/Meinhardt's/Urban Fare (for you Vancouverites who will know what I mean). Great restaurants everywhere: try Ciro right across the street for a nice Italian meal and even Fing Yo again right across the street for yummy Chinese food (take-out mainly but a few tables for eat-in). The subway and bus stop are handy. You can also walk almost everywhere downtown to the big name stores for shopping, if you don't mind a 10 minute walk or so - we didn't.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, wonderful room and great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff are so friendly and helpful. Our room was quite large for NYC standards with a fridge (nice to have cold yogurts and juice to snack on) and microwave, coffee-maker etc. The room was QUIET, too -- incredible since we were right in the centre of everything!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC VALUE FOR MONEY!!

reviews.text: We won't stay anywhere else in NYC!!
reviews.title: Nothing bad to say about this hotel

reviews.text: This was a great hotel. The front desk was always busy, but the staff was always friendly. Checking in was a breeze.
reviews.title: Perfect for Midtown!

reviews.text: There was never a wait for the elevator, something that I have found to be a big problem in New York. My 12th floor room looked out over 8th Ave--not the city's prettiest, but it was a view nevertheless. It was also suprisingly quiet.
reviews.title: BIG rooms for Midtown....great price!

reviews.text: The room was of average size, but it was clean and it had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The ergonomic chair at the work desk was great, and the high-speed internet was free!
reviews.title: Unwelcomed Visitor in Our Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was fairly plain, but clean.
reviews.title: Stop thinking - book it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a mini-fridge and a microwave, so the Food Emporium next door to the hotel was a great alternative from always needing to eat out. Buy gourmet food and take it with you.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

likes.liked: — cleanliness and moderness of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Garden Inn is a great place to stay in NYC. Close to everything yet not in the middle of the rush. Due to the weather we missed the first night in the hotel and I still feel we got a great deal.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

likes.liked: — Large rooms, free Internet, fridge, microwave, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are HUGE for NYC, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. I've stayed at several hotels in the vicinity and this one is by far the best. You can't go wrong. Our room faced 8th but was up high and didn't have any problem with noise. Subway is right around the corner, and access to most of the Broadway shows was very convenient by taking 8th instead of fighting the crowds on Broadway. I'm looking forward to staying here again, and would even pay more vs. another hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location with a Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect for us. From The Lion King to seeing Les Paul at the Iridium, we were minutes from our chosen venues. A subway stop right across the street took us directly to the financial district.
reviews.title: Irish Bars

reviews.text: Our first evening we walked to St. Pat's for Mass and then up to the Top of the Rock to see the skyline at night. While the view is impressive, it was an overpriced elevator ride.
reviews.title: Baby Friendly hotel right at TImes Square

likes.disliked: — A/C was on even though we had the thermostat up to 75F

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed milling around Rockefeller Center and grabbed a light meal at Lobster City on the way back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect stay over Christmas!

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed one night at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square for a "getaway" evening. We booked the hotel at their website for $179 plus tax.
reviews.title: Can't Fault The Staff

likes.disliked: — The beds, the exterior noise staying on the 2nd floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I start the review, I want to emphasize that the staff was excellent and tried to accommodate my needs at every turn.
reviews.title: can't go wrong!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were put in a "two queen sized bed" room upon check-in based on lack of availability of a "king sized bed". The room size was fine, but, the actual beds are the cheap kind and are very springy. This was on the 12th floor. Way too plush. So, when I asked to see if there was a king sized room, they were great and assigned us to a 2nd floor room. This one had a king sized bed in one of their handicapped equipped rooms. I asked for the front desk to adjust the firmness of the bed with their dial on the bed (it was an air adjustable bed) which seemed to do the trick. The bedspreads are low thread count and cheap looking.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean & Quiet Room

likes.disliked: — Would have liked an upgraded room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the luck of the draw may have it, there was a loud, periodic clanging sounds (like construction) throughout the night above us and we could not sleep. I figured since they went through the trouble of getting us a hard to find king room, we could not ask to be moved again. So, we suffered through the night without sleep. A word of warning that you can hear the subway underneath you if you stay on the 2nd floor. Plus, the hallway looks slightly dingy.
reviews.title: simply the best!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, as someone who usually stays in Hilton Garden Inn quite a bit, this was a big disappointment because of the random chance that you just get "one of those rooms" where it is noisy. However, the location was great, the staff was wonderful, the restaurant Pigalle next door was excellent and reasonably priced with the rooms being standard what you would expect from HGI.
reviews.title: Good size room and service but noisy!

reviews.text: There was a glitch in our arrival at midnight and it took quite some time to get our room. The hotel made up for it by providing free breakfast vouchers at Pigalles the adjoining restaruant. That did help! We loved everything about our stay except for the beds. The mattresses were soft and mushy and we are used to a firmer mattress. But aside from that the staff is courteous and you cannot beat the location. We never heard a sound on the 9th floor. We could not believe how quiet the area was around this hotel and yet you go up a few blocks and there you are in the midst of huge crowds. Our family of four was quite comfortable and we had room to put a blow up mattress on the floor for our teenage son. (There is not enough space for a roll-away.) We loved being right around the corner from our play, Wicked and the subway being so close made getting around an enjoyable experience. Pigalles is a great restarant but the service is a little on the slow side so if you are in a hurry you may want to go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Helpful employees and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one week. We found the rooms to be adequately sized for us, our luggage and all of the souveniers that we purchased during our stay and very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly. "Charles" the doorman was very helpful in getting us cabs and helping with our luggage. We also enjoyed talking to "Donald" who was very helpful in finding restaraunts and shops in the area. The housekeeping was done in a timely and efficient manner and we didn't have to call for anything. We stayed on the 9th floor. We could hear the subways but the noise was not disturbing at all. The only noise of the city that we heard were horns and the firetruck sirens from the station around the corner. The beds here were really, really comfortable...so much so that we had a hard time waking up every morning! The location was great and within walking distance to many things. Cabs are plentiful here and there is subway access just a block away. There is a very good bar/restaraunt called the "Social" just across the street. There is also a little convenience store in the lobby for anything you might forget. Our only complaint is that one afternoon while we were in our room planning our day a housekeeping employee (maybe a supervisor?) came into our room unannounced using a master key. She asked us if everything was okay and then left. She went into other rooms too. Maybe it was a security check or something but we were sure glad we weren't in the middle of "something" when she came in! Other than that a great hotel and we've already talked about going back next year and staying here again!
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week end of June 2008. We were not disappointed and very pleased with the hotel. The front desk staff were helpful and responsive. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor at the back of the hotel because I know how noisy NYC can be. It was quiet and we slept very well. Comfortable king size bed, clean nicely appointed room for a moderate price (well under $400 which is pretty good for New York). Very close to subway, theaters, shopping. I was there with my 13 yr old daughter and we felt very safe. Free internet access and flat screen TV were great. We also liked the small fridge as we had a place to put our leftovers from meals when we ate out and also the food we bought from the Food Emporium next door to the hotel. A few years ago we stayed in a top rated boutique hotel(I will not mention the name here) also in the Times Square/Theater District area, and it was noisy and double the price. The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square was quiet, much more comfortable and an overall a better experience. Remember to ask for a high floor. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: highly recommended moderately priced hotel

likes.liked: — Quiet, close to theaters, restaurants, other places of interest in NYC
likes.disliked: — Nothing really. Renovating the hallways during our stay (not on our floor)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a week June/July. After much research, I picked the Hilton Garden Inn. It's midtown location, proximity to theaters (5 min. max walk to most), reasonable price and Hilton name motivated my choice. We were thrilled with the property on all accounts. The front desk, concierge, business center (to print boarding passes for flight home), free wi fi in room and even housekeeping were all thoroughly helpful and accommodating. The room is a nice size and clean. There is a fridge and microwave available which we used for breakfast/snack stuff. Subway is around the block, a Food Emporium (grocery) is steps away. Each Broadway show we took in was a block or 2 away from our front door. Times Square is a block away, but the noise/lights are not an issue. We stayed on the 6th floor, heard regular street noise that is expected in a large city, but not bothersome. We slept without issue. We used the subway and were able to get where ever we wanted to go in minutes. People were extremely helpful and more than willing to give us assistance with directions, etc. Loved the city and all it had to offer. Enjoy your time!!
reviews.title: Great New York experience!!

likes.liked: — location to theater, midtown location, Hilton name

reviews.text: I have just come back from a 4 nights stay at Hilton Garden Inn at Times Square. It is a very well priced hotel considering all that it offers. Having a microwave and fridge in the room was wonderful. The business centre which gives free internet access is also a big plus. The bedroom was spacious and, although a bit on the small side, the bathroom was fine. I found the staff very helpful and pleasant. I was on the 3rd floor and I could vaguely hear the subway noise occasionally but it certainly did not disturb me in any way. I had never stayed in the Times Square area before and was a bit hesitant about it being so crowded. This is really not a concern and it is a real buzz to know that all the great shows and jazz clubs are within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Anyway, I would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly for anyone wanting a comfortable, safe stay in New York city.
reviews.title: Great find in New York

likes.liked: — microwave in the room and free internet access at business centre
likes.disliked: — The bath plug was a bit difficult to close properly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As one who knows NYC and stays here often this is a great midtown choice if the following is important to you:
reviews.title: Good Midtown Choice for many Reasons
Gets a "10" from me!
reviews.text: 1. Great theatre/restaurant row location
2. Times Square is a block away
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The flat screen TV, comfy bed and excellent customer service
likes.disliked: — I guess it doesn't look too impressive from the outside, but who cares.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Access to subway lines very close (A,C,E within one block (50th) <easy from Penn Station> or Times Square subway station <which pretty much gets you anywhere in the city>)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: 4. Hotel itself is clean, decent size rooms for NYC, microwave, refer and pleasant staff willing to help<no typical NY aloofness>
reviews.title: Not Bad At All

reviews.text: We booked 3 rooms in this hotel well in advance and got a fantastic advance purchase rate. Unfortunately we could not have rooms on the same floor as eachother, but as we arrived late in the day in peak season this is understandable. The rooms were very comfortable and roomy enough for Manhattan. The doormen were always happy and helpful. I did get sick of being bugged by tour sales people as i stepped out each time, but i guess that's the area. It was safe at night with constant streat past the front door. We walked to so many places including Times Square, Madison Square Garden and Central Park from here. Towards the end of our 5 night stay i got sick and my sister talked to the front desk. They organised for their hotel doctor to come and see me and i was very impressed. The lobby was a nice cool relaxing place to wait for our group. If we can get such a super rate again i would book instantly as it was so convienient!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel after reading so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed! Our room was large, clean, quiet and had free wi-fi. The location is perfect: an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, nearby subway station, etc. Being near to the theatre district, there are also plenty of restaurants in close proximity (we loved Becco www.becco-nyc.com). Needless to say we agree wholeheartedly with the other reviews!
reviews.title: Fantastic choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in HGI Times square in Feb 2009, and what can I say this hotel is great. So good that I have booked again for May 2010, Just 7 weeks to go and I Can’t wait! When re-booking we didn't even think about booking any other hotel other then this one! Staff were great, very friendly and remembered you when you walked through the lobby, our room 1521 (Hope I get the same one this time) was on the top floor facing 8th Avenue, and with views if the Hudson River. The room was massive and the bed was the best I’ve ever slept on. We had free coffee making facilities and a fridge, and the wifi was free! Location was great 1 block away from Times Square, Broadway theatres and next door to a super market, (which you can get microwave food as there is one in the room.) As other reviews say the hotel is next to a fire house, but this never caused any problems, after all we are in NYC and I think your in the wrong place if you going to complain about hearing the odd siren and horns Blowing. I would go as far to say this is one of the best hotels I have been in and easily matches up to it's parent company’s standards. If not better in some instances! See you again in 7 weeks HGI Times Square. I have recommended this hotel time over.
reviews.title: WOW!!! Can wait to return in may 2010.

reviews.text: This hotel has spacious, well appointed rooms for the cost, I was very happily surprised! A quick block to Times Square, or 2 quick blocks to the best Broadway shows. The room was fantastic - there is a refrigerator(rare these days) so you can stock up at the 24 hour gift/snack shop shop in the lobby. The wifi was fast and free. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom clean and well stocked. The restaurant was great - we ate dinner there late after our show and the food was delicious.
reviews.title: Outstanding value, location and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I brought along my daughter and her friend so after my business engagement, we could have a little vacation. We were late getting out of the room and to the train. In our haste to leave, I accidentally left behind some good leather shoes and an ipod docking station w/ speakers. I didn't unpack until 2 days later and when I figured this out, I called the hotel. The head of housekeeping, Shirley, was FABULOUS - she located my things, they were carefully wrapped and inventoried in the lost and found. She put them in UPS express ground box and here I am, a few days later, with my items. I find this unbelievable in this day in age! What great customer service.
reviews.title: Book early to avoid disappointment, it's very popular and I now know why.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent the 4th of July weekend at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square. As others have written, the hotel is conveniently located. Its within walking distance to the subway and theaters. Our cab ride from La Guardia to the hotel was about $35. The staff served us excellently . The hotel was rennovating the hall way on the floor we stayed on -- wall coverings were taken off, etc. So, you may want to ask if they are rennovating the floor when it comes time to get your room. As HHonors members we received a free daily breakfast. The breakfast was in the hotel's Pigalle restaurant and the breakfast menu was limited. Amongst the choices were eggs, omlets, a waffle dish and granola dish. Free wireless worked well. We also used the free printers downstairs to print out tickets. We had a pleasant stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location; Good Service; Good Value Hotel

reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was thinking we were going to be staying at a real nice place - it was average. It was clean, but not quiet. There are no frills at this place - only about 10 cookies at the desk which goes very fast. It is close to Times Square, the City Sights bus and subways. I would not stay again, I would either go a little more out or pay a little more and go towards Time Square.
reviews.title: Nice - but overrated

reviews.text: The Hilton Garden Inn was everything I was hoping it would be. The rooms are very large by NYC standards. Everything was clean and well maintained. There is free internet in the rooms, and a work station for those without their own computers. Everyone we dealt with in the hotel was helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to everything...subway stations, restaurants, Times Square, the theatres, etc.
reviews.title: Great Location Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, who is very picky, said it best: "When we come back, we're staying here!"
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on 12/25 and 12/26. The hotel is in an excellent location and provides nice, clean rooms of decent size at good rates. Our room with 2 queen beds was equipped with a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, flat screen TV, iron, in room safe, etc. We didn’t have much of a view because we faced another building, but I didn’t expect too much with our last minute reservation. We were originally booked for one night only (12/26) at another hotel on the same block for $259 for the one night (granted it is a nicer hotel). On 12/22 we decided to add Christmas night and look for deals. We stayed for 2 nights with full breakfast for two both days and the total charge was $256; taxes included. This sets the record for our least expensive stay in NYC. It was our third visit during 2006. We generally visit 2-3 times per year. We will most definitely consider staying at Hilton Garden Inn again.
reviews.title: Excellent Value in NYC

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square (actually 8th Avenue at 47th street a few blocks northwewst of Times Square, super convenient to the Theatre district and most midtown attractions) over Christmas weekend. We booked online using a AAA discount and paid $130 a night plus tax. This is an excellent rate for New York City so I wasn't expecting much. The hotel exceeded my expectations, though there is still room for improvement.
reviews.title: Excellent Deal, Great Location, Complacement Staff

reviews.text: The GOOD:
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square

reviews.text: Clean, very spacious room. It had a two double beds, an efficient heating system, windows that actually opened, and a nice flat screen TV with many channels (this seems to be one of their prime ameniities.) The room was among the largest and cleanest I've stayed in in NYC for this price. A microwave, fridge and coffeemaker was included in the room.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, no pretense

reviews.text: The BAD:
reviews.title: Met expectations and then some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had thoroughly researched this hotel before booking as it had excellent reveiws. The only (but very inconvenient) problem we encountered was on arrival. After being awake for 24 hours and travelling for approx 18 of those (early check in required in UK at the time) we arrived excited but exhausted at the hotel on our first trip to New York at midnight local time. We were told the bad news was the hotel was overbooked but the good news was that they were prepared to move us to a superior hotel and pay for the taxi. I was astonished, not only that they'd overbooked the hotel (did they forget to count the rooms?) but also at the assupmtion that I should be grateful they were going to find me somewhere to stay. After 10 minutes of attempting to get hold of the other hotel and finding cash for a taxi we were sent out onto the busy Saturday night streets with a porter who atempted to hail a taxi for another 10mins (my reserved English temprement was starting to fray). Eventually the manager came out and negotiated with some sort of private hire car, at the this did not feel like a particulaly safe option but I was too exhaused to argue....luckily we did arrive at the other hotel which was clean and quite for what remained of the night. We were checked in to the hilton quickly the next day (after finding and paying for out own taxi back) and offered a free meal in the adjoining restaurant. Again the duty manger seemed to think we ought to be eternally grateful for this and the fact that they had paid for us to stay somewhere else. I found this to be unacceptable service as we had pre booked including airport transfers eight weeks in advance to avoid such an inconvenience. Other than this the hotel was clean and in an a convenient location for sightseeing. We had a room on the forteenth floor which was still fairly noisy as the seals on the windows had gone. In addition as we were so high up we could hear the air conditioning fans on the roof even with the unit in our room turned off. On the plus side plenty of space, nice neutral decor and kept clean.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.text: We booked the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square because of the queen beds, as we were three women traveling together. The beds were incredibly comfortable; not hard like most hotel beds. The flatscreen TV was nice too. The rooms had plenty of room for our luggage and for us to spread out. And contrary to another review, we DID have a safe in our room. We did not have any trouble with noise.
reviews.title: Great place and location

reviews.text: The location was fantastic. It is in easy walking distance to broadway theaters and to the subway stations. The Greyline tours also start nearby.
reviews.title: Large Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel, as it didn't work into our schedule. We did eat at the Olympic Diner across the street, twice for breakfast, and twice for dinner. We disagree with another reviewer who didn't like it. The variety was great, the service was fast, and prices were reasonable. Just right for a quick bite before a play. We also ate at the mexican restaurant, Sombrero, across the street, and we do NOT recommend it. The food was mediocre, the portions were small, and the prices were high.
reviews.title: Good handy place to stay

likes.liked: — No character but typical clean, reliable chain hotel
likes.disliked: — Don't forget to pick up the free cookies at the reception desk that appear in the afternoon!

reviews.text: We found the bell staff at the hotel to be very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Just right

likes.liked: — Proximity to Times Square, clean and felt safe.
likes.disliked: — It was not next door to Macys (its sale time)

reviews.text: We booked our stay based on reviews on this site and because of an attractive rate. We weren't disappointed! The hotel was updated, clean, comfortable, spacious (for New York City) and offered a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the theater district, Times Square, and many other attractions. Rooms were very clean, well maintained and despite a window that overlooked busy 8th Avenue, we slept wonderfully. We found the hotel staff to be first rate and really liked the location. There is no breakfast, but we ate very economically by walking less than a block to a wonderful grocery with a full deli and bakery. We'd make our own coffee, one of us would bring back bagels and fruit and we kept juice in the room refrigerator.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Super Service in a great location

reviews.text: As midwesterners, we were a little wary about safety issues, never felt less than safe and comfortable at this hotel as well as in New York City in general. I know you won't be disappointed if you stay here.
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff I Have Ever Met....Along with a Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff and people took better care of us at this hotel than at other much higher end hotels ever have. They took initiative to contact us before the trip asking if we needed anything and continued once we arrived. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly....from the desk to cleaning staff, to bell men, to the wait staff. Can't recommend the service enough. The hotel was very standard for a Hilton Garden. Nice 'regular' size rooms, close to the theater district and restaurants. Bravo!!
reviews.title: No room breakfast room service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really thought that this ammenity was a given- breakfast room service. It is a Hilton!
reviews.title: Good Experience

reviews.text: The hotel key card had an egg that said "start your day off with a great breakfast". And perhaps I am spoiled for wanting to wake up for a liesurely breakfast in my room before starting my day. Can you imagine my surprise when I arrived and realized there is NO breakfast room service available.... ! So disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location, what you expect from Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location for theater and restaurants. Any time you can get a room rate for $200 or less in New York in a good location, you've got to wonder. This king room was very comfortable, huge for NY with great bed. Every room has fridge and microwave, coffee maker and free internet, plus free use of 2 computers off the lobby in the business center. Fitness room is barely adequate--serious exercisers will probably want to go to a nearby gym. Restaurant was decent, but a bit expensive, but numerous cheaper alternatives are within half a block. A great stay. This will be our base for future trips to NY.
reviews.title: Great value for NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned home tonight after a 4 night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn-NYC. Having just moved to Michigan a few months ago from Manhattan (where I lived for the past 10 years), I was very leery about staying at an "inexpensive" Manhattan Hotel (a while back, we stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria, which was very expensive and just okay). Prior to moving to Manhattan in 1996, I traveled to NYC a lot and stayed in some real dives...so again, I was skeptical and not expecting a whole lot when I booked this hotel at $149.00 per night plus taxes over the Christmas Holiday. To my surprise, our stay was really nice and my husband and I enjoyed the Hilton very much!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay...

likes.liked: — Efficiency of staff, proximity to subways, great location to exciting attractions, proximity to good restaurants
likes.disliked: — Lobby is quite small and it felt overcrowded most of the time!

reviews.text: My husband and I arrived at the Hilton on Friday afternoon, 12/22/06 and although we were a few hours early, our early check-in was no problem and the process went smoothly. The desk staff honored my request for a non-smoking room on an upper floor and they even allowed us to obtain our key cards and go up to our room several hours early.
reviews.title: Everything great except check-in

likes.liked: — Quick and easy service from bellmen; everything about the room

reviews.text: The rooms at this Hilton are relatively large for a New York City hotel. They are furnished in typical "business-style" Hilton...nothing super fancy, but's that's okay! Everything in the room functioned perfectly. The forced-hot air heater was comfortable and easy to regulate. The room was comfortable and exceptionally clean.The bathroom while small, was clean, comfortable and relaxing. The room had more than ample closet and dresser space. The view from our room was of a back alley but again...that's what you get in even some of the best hotels in NYC...not all four sides of a building have beautiful views! A view, however, was a non-issue for us! For us, the room suited our needs and we felt safe, comfortable and relaxed.
reviews.title: Good location but Noisy

reviews.text: Additionally, two of the best aspects of this hotel for my husband and I were the hotel's proximity to the A, C, E and #1 subway lines and the convenience to multiple Times Square attractions, including great restaurants, fabulous sites and wonderful activity!
reviews.title: Great Location, big rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say --- Excellent hotel and perfect location!!!!! The king room was more than adequate in size and clean! The bathroom sink had a countertop area for your 'stuff'. The bed was very comfy! there was a desk with/chair and then a comfy chair with ottoman....room had a microwave and mini fridge with flatscreen tv!!! FYI - NO in room safes......There were no 'noise issues' either from the street or others rooms (and we were were there over Thanksgiving)--- we were on the top floor....view out window was overlooking some rooftops and skyscrapers and the sky! NICE!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel -- perfect Location!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — I got everything I asked for! Excellent room and perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received everything we asked for from this hotel and would definitely return!!! It's close to everything!!!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, one Block from Time square and right in the heart of the Theatre district. Our stay at this hotel was very enjoyable. Rooms were comfortable (beds extremely comfortable) and very clean.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for my trip!

likes.liked: — great location - right off broadway, close to times square
likes.disliked: — cookies only in lobby the first night!

reviews.text: Hotel is close to the Subway and Port Authority Bus Station. You couldnt get a better location for exploring the city.
reviews.title: What else could you want?

reviews.text: Front desk and concierge were helpful and even gave us a late check out (2pm).
reviews.title: Rescued by the Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, updated and roomy (for New York)! A microwave and empty mini fridge are in every room. Definitely request a high floor - 8th street is definitely a busy street.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative we experienced was a very unfriendly front desk clerk, I believe his name was Terry. We were greeted by an annoyed man who asked us our name, asked for a credit card and gave us our room. I guess effiecient, but definitely not even close to welcoming. Good thing the room and location is really what matters:)
reviews.title: This hotel saved our stay!
A Perfect 10!
reviews.text: Location, location location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked another New York hotel as part of East Coast tour of Boston, New York and Washington.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: The hotel we had originally booked was so awful we didn't bother unpacking our suitcases. After ringing around and internet searches we settled on the Garden Inn Times Square.
reviews.title: Very friendly

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel and enjoyed the location for visiting Broadway and Times Square.
reviews.title: Great location for Broadway Shows

reviews.text: The staff is very efficient and concerned about service. They just seemed to be missing the warmth I expect from people in the hospitality industry. On the other hand, this was New York. Rooms were clean. Some noise from nearby fire station and resulting calls through the night. Ask for a room as high above the street noise as you can get. Many delis and food opportunities close by. In room fridge and microwave a plus.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Wonderful Location!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square from the 29th December 2008 and checked out on the 8th of January 2009. (Again - this review is late!) This was my first time ever travelling overseas and to the US and NYC. I booked the Hilton Garden Inn after reading the great reviews here on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed!
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, thoroughly enjoyed our stay here
Good hotel well located for sightseeing
reviews.text: The staff at the front desk, at the door and the concierge are all excellent! Not once were there any problems with any of the staff and they were all so polite. There is a small business centre in the Lobby with 4 computers from memory, with a printer etc which was great to have as we used this a lot when planning what we wanted to the next day etc.

reviews.title: super- super-super
reviews.text: The room that we had was King Evolution room which was great! It was very roomy and the view that we had from the room was great. We were on the 14th Floor as i had requested a high floor as other trip advisor reviewers had recommended! The noise from the street was not a big deal at all and it was still easy to sleep here.

We planned a girls only trip to the city and selected the Hilton Garden primarily because we were using Hilton Honors Points and the room was reasonably priced for the two nights we were paying and not using points. Once we arrived and got our bearings, we were very pleased with our hotel selection. The location is just perfect. Times Square is a few blocks away and there are many subway lines within a block or two of the hotel. Everything you need is at your disposal. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and service oriented. Charles the Bell Man was outstanding. He amused my 10 year old daughter on a daily basis and added a bright spot each morning as we headed out for an adventure. As a Diamond member with Hilton, we received complimentary breakfast each morning. What made this special and unique was that the breakfast was served at Pigalle Restaurant which is connected to the hotel. What a nice treat to have something different than the standard Hilton Garden buffet. There were about 6 items to chose from for the free breakfast and all were excellent. Since we were there for 8 days, we made our way through the menu. I can honestly say that there really wasn't much to criticize at the hotel. I think the only drawback is that the rooms are on the small side. This was another motel that was renovated by Hilton, so there isn't much you can do with the rooms as far as size goes. There were two adult women and one child in the room and we did fine. You just need to plan your bathroom/showers accordingly to avoid confusion and congestion. Also, we had some family join us for two nights and they stayed on the third floor. Evidently, the subway was quite noisy and very noticeable on that floor. We stayed on the 12th floor and didn't hear a thing. In fact, it was quite surprising how little we did hear of the outside world. The beds were also very comfortable and allowed for a peaceful nights rest.
reviews.title: Great location and even better service

likes.disliked: — would prefer larger room with separate sink/vanity area

reviews.text: This property has it all, location and great staff. If smaller size rooms don't bother you, this property should be at the top of your list. (just request a high floor to avoid subway noise)
reviews.title: great location and comfortable
Stay above the 4th floor!
reviews.text: location was great and room was clean and comfortable. breakfast is at a french brasserie on the ground floor. we had theater tickets and it was easy to walk to dinner and theater. we were there new years eve and it was crazy, but everything worked out fine. we were up pretty high so we never heard any noise.

Don't get me wrong. The hotel is in a great location, it’s clean and the staff were friendly. However, I stayed on the 2nd floor and the noise of the Subway penetrates into the room. Baring in mind that the trains run every few minutes on the E line and they run quite late, it became very disturbing. When I complained they said that they were full and were very sorry and next time when I check in I could ask for a room higher up.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Standard of Accommodation in NY

reviews.text: I would stay here again but I will not be staying lower than the 4th floor.
reviews.title: Great location and nice friendly hotel!

likes.disliked: — A little noisy but nothing too bad!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at the end of November 2007 and loved it. This hotel offers very big/clean/well-outfitted rooms, a friendly staff and a wonderful location. The standard room was large (not NYC-like at all), had a fridge, microwave and a nice flat-panel TV. It was not decadent at all, but very nice. The free internet was a nice touch, but I couldn't get the wireless to work, so I needed to keep my laptop at the desk - not a big deal. Note, if you are checking in here, ask for a room that doesn't face 8th avenue because it can be loud on that street and some sirens woke me up. I suspect the rooms on the other side that overlook a parking lot would be much quieter.
reviews.title: Great Hotel/Great Location/Great Staff

reviews.text: In terms of value, I can't speak to that because I used Hilton Points, but it looked like it would be an expensive place, like $500 a night, bearing in mind it's the holiday season in NYC and the place/city was packed. We arrived the day of the rockefeller center christmas tree lighting.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: The best part of this place is location. You're two blocks from times square with a nice, safe street to walk on to get there, taxis are readily available outside the hotel and there are numerous entrances to most of the subways in close proximity. There are some great restaurants in close proximity and the restaurant in the hotel was great for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very happy with this property and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to a friend. They even had fresh-baked cookies at the counter at night.
reviews.title: Recommend the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square

reviews.text: Negatives? Small bathroom with some rough finishing work done (huge lines of caulking around the door, curling wallpaper) and the hot water was sometimes marginal.
reviews.title: Excellent base, wonderful staff.

likes.liked: — Good size rooms & really comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second Thanksgiving stay at Times Square HGI.
reviews.title: Great place-location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes get a higher floor if you can, NYC is a noisy city.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.text: Room clean, comfortable, well kept. Staff was VERY accomodating.
reviews.title: Good location & customer service, stay on a high floor!
good and bad about this hotel
reviews.text: On the breakfast plan, ate next door at Pigalle. Food was good, servers RUN- they are very busy. One block off Times Square, ten minute walk to Rockefeller center, 5th ave. Twenty minute walk to central park.
We had a wonderful stay here. The Front desk is friendly, fast and accomodating. The Concierge (Olga and Agnes) pleasant and try hard to get tickets you need.
reviews.title: Not a Fan of the Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights from 1st Feb 2008 and enjoyed the experience. The only down side, which was rectified promptly, was the air con fan right outside the room but this was switched off for most of the time after a phone call.
reviews.title: Top marks for Location, service and cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the other reviews I have read say the location is great and I agree with them, close enough to Times Square but just far enough away to miss the crowds. Good bars and restaurants in the area and I did not use the hotel restaurant. Recommend the bar in W5st Street with loads of great beers.
reviews.title: Great hotel, would recommend !

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights from 26 Jan. We were very impressed with the hotel, staff and location. One block from Times Square, ideal location for going out in either direction, you can walk to 5th Avenue and central park from the hotel. Staff were really helpful with directions when going out and happy to give you different options for travel etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was really well equiped, large king bed, flat screen TV, fridge and microwave. Although you don't spend a lot of time in the room the home comforts were really well appreciated at the end of a long day. Bed was lovely. Bathroom was very clean and plenty of towels, changed every day.
reviews.title: Very good price/quality relation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a chemist, deli, bar and lots of take away food places just outside the hotel. The port authority bus station is just a short walk from the hotel which is where you can catch the bus to Woodbury Common outlet centre (1 hour bus ride, $39 return) which is well worth the trip to save some $ on shopping.
reviews.title: Worth considering for midtown!
Great Location, Friendly Staff, Good Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is located 1 block from Times Square. Many places to eat around here. Efficient staff, nice, clean, quiet rooms. Safe and secure. Not much to not like!

We got a corporate rate through my company for our stay. We paid about $210 a night and the rate included breakfast. The trip was a personal trip and my husband and I with my 8 month old daugther celebrated father's day here together. First off, NYC is very expensive and so you must always have cash on hand. If you expect any kind of reasonable service from the bell hops, etc, you must tip them. Tip them well b/c you will need them. We had a king room on floor 15 and it was lovely. It had a fridge and microwave and a nice flat screen tv. Our room was quite large however our bathroom was very tiny. The door barely misses the toilet when you try to open it. That is typical of NYC hotels from what I've experienced and the size of the general room more than made up for it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to EVERYTHING!

likes.liked: — proximity to times square and room quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate included breakfast as I mentioned, and it was quite good. It was at the restaurant attached to the hotel and was very hearty. There is a set menu for you to choose from which included waffles with bacon or an omelette with bacon and potatoes. It filled us up and so we were good for about 6 hours!
reviews.title: Great location to Times Square and clean Hotel

likes.liked: — Great size rooms, friendly staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Times square is about 2 blocks around the corner. Very close proximity and an easy walk. We even walked to Pier 83 which is where all the boat tours are. We paid $29 each (adults) for the tour and it took us halfway around the island for 2 hours. We got to see the statue of liberty up close and all the bridges. It was fantastic and was operated by circle line 42. I would suggest arriving 45 min early to secure a space in line. We got on the boat last and wound up with mediocre seats. We eventually got to stand at the beginning of the boat to see the water.
reviews.title: Location is great!

reviews.text: Check out Mesa Grill (Bobby Flay's restaurant) if you have time. The food is to die for. Excellent chef that one is (My yodaism for the day).
reviews.title: Nice retreat from busy streets

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Hotel
description: Prime Times Square location with COMPLIMENTARY amenities including Internet, fitness center, business center & more! Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is a modern hotel with best Times Square location that is steps from Broadway theaters, Restaurant Row, TKTS discount theater ticket booth, famous 42nd Street and much more. Located on Eighth Avenue at 48th Street in the heart of Times Square, the hotel is in the midst of New York City’s best restaurants, lively nightlife, sightseeing and shopping. Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is walking distance to all major subway lines, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Carnegie Hall, the Museum of Modern Art, Jacob Javits Convention Center and Port Authority Bus Terminal plus is convenient to all (3) area airports.The hotel features 369 oversized, contemporary-styled guestrooms each equipped with 32-inch LCD flat panel television, refrigerator, microwave, safe, coffeemaker large work desk with ergonomic chair and complimentary Internet access with secure remote printing to the hotel’s Business Center. COMPLIMENTARY amenities include high-speed lobby and guestroom Internet access, 24-hour Business Center, 24-hour Fitness Center, morning coffee and tea in the lobby and USA Today®. Additional onsite amenities include Pigalle Restaurant and Lounge (a 1950’s style Paris café that is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner), XVI Rooftop Lounge (the only Hilton Garden Inn in Manhattan with a rooftop bar!), evening room service, 24-hour Pavilion Pantry (stocked with your favorite snacks, drinks & toiletries) and Concierge/Theater Ticket Desk. The hotel is 100% non-smoking. Self parking is available. The hotel allows service pets. 24-hour Security onsite.
